rules: Rule1: If the treatment was successful in lab mice, then the clinical trial was not completed by the deadline.
Rule2: Provided that the treatment was successful in ferrets, the clinical trial was not completed by the deadline.
Rule3: Under the condition that the microscope was replaced with a new model, the microscope is functional in the lab.
Rule4: The microscope was replaced with a new model or it was repaired by a technician.
Rule5: If the microscope was repaired by a technician, then either the microscope malfunctioned in week three, or if funding is not currently active, then the lab equipment was not calibrated daily.
Rule6: If drug X was tested on lab mice, then it is effective against canine parvovirus.
Rule7: Either drug X was tested on lab mice, or drug X is not approved by the FDA.
Rule8: Provided that the staff were certified for competency, they were trained in new techniques.
Rule9: Whenever a complete data set was acquired, the spectrometer is operational for analysis.
Rule10: If the data set was processed using software, then under the condition that the spectrometer was configured with settings, it was connected to the network.
Rule11: Assuming the data were analyzed by a statistician, a complete data set was acquired.
Rule12: Provided that the data were verified by a supervisor, the data set was processed using software.
Rule13: Whenever the report was submitted to the committee, it follows that either the data were analyzed by a statistician or they were verified by a supervisor.
Rule14: If the report was reviewed by peers, then either the data were analyzed by a statistician or they were verified by a supervisor.
Rule15: Under the condition that drug X is effective against canine parvovirus, it is safe for puppies.
Rule16: Either the paper was accepted by a conference, or either the report was submitted to the committee or the report was reviewed by peers.
Rule17: Whenever security protocol was implemented, security was maintained by the system.

Rule18: If security was maintained by the system, then under the condition that it is not the case that if funding is not currently active, then the database was connected to the server, records are accessible remotely.
Rule19: Either the trial was halted for safety, or if a mild side effect was discovered, then provided that drug X is effective against canine parvovirus, it is not safe for puppies.
Rule20: Either the dosage was modified to be reduced, or if drug X is effective against canine parvovirus, then it is approved for veterinary use.
Rule21: Either an adverse reaction was observed in subjects, or the dosage was not modified to be reduced.
Rule22: Whenever patients were monitored closely, their condition was stabilized.
Rule23: Provided that patients' condition was stabilized, an adverse reaction was not observed in subjects.
Rule24: Whenever the formula was patented by the company, the technology was not licensed to a partner.
Rule25: Assuming the product was manufactured at the facility, the technology was licensed to a partner.
Rule26: Either an extension was granted by the patent office, or if an application was filed for renewal, then the patent protection did not expire.
Rule27: Provided that drug X is effective in rodents, the treatment was successful in lab mice.
Rule28: Either drug X is effective in rodents or it is effective in mustelids.
Rule29: If drug X is approved for veterinary use, then it is not safe for puppies.
Rule30: If additional personnel were hired, then under the condition that the research scope was expanded, then if funding was received for continuation, recognition was awarded to the team.
Rule31: Either additional personnel were hired, or external consultants were contracted.

Rule32: Either the project timeline was delayed, or if external consultants were contracted, then assuming the research scope was expanded, then if funding was received for continuation, recognition was awarded to the team.
Rule33: Whenever the timeline was accelerated through efforts, all deadlines were met.
Rule34: Either the timeline was accelerated through efforts, or processes were optimized for efficiency.
Rule35: Provided that processes were optimized for efficiency, the project timeline was not delayed.
Rule36: Under the condition that all deadlines were met, the project timeline was not delayed.
Rule37: Either drug X was administered during a clinical trial, or if drug X is effective against canine parvovirus, then it is approved for veterinary use.
Rule38: If the research period was extended by six months, then the clinical trial was completed by the deadline.
Rule39: If it is not the case that either the treatment was successful in lab mice or it was successful in ferrets, then the results were published in a journal.
Rule40: Provided that it is not the case that either the treatment was successful in lab mice or it was successful in ferrets, the formula was patented by the company.
Rule41: Whenever it is not the case that either the treatment was successful in lab mice or it was successful in ferrets, the results were not published in a journal.

Rule42: Under the condition that it is not the case that either the procedures were documented in the manual, or if the microscope is functional in the lab, then either the microscope malfunctioned in week three, or if funding is not currently active, then the lab equipment was not calibrated daily, the staff were certified for competency.

Rule43: If it is not the case that either the procedures were documented in the manual, or if the microscope is functional in the lab, then either the microscope malfunctioned in week three, or if funding is not currently active, then the lab equipment was not calibrated daily, then the staff were not trained in new techniques.
Rule44: Provided that it is not the case that if the formula was patented by the company, then the product was manufactured at the facility, the patent protection expired.
Rule45: If it is not the case that if drug X is effective in mustelids, then the treatment was successful in ferrets, then funding was received for continuation.
Rule46: Whenever it is not the case that either a research grant funded the project or funding is currently active, the research period was extended by six months.
Rule47: Provided that it is not the case that if funding is not currently active, then the database was connected to the server, records are not accessible remotely.
Rule48: If funding is not currently active, then drug X is approved by the FDA.
Rule49: Under the condition that funding is not currently active, the lab equipment was calibrated daily.
Rule50: If funding is not currently active, then the spectrometer was configured with settings.
Rule51: If funding is not currently active, then the spectrometer was not connected to the network.
Rule52: Under the condition that funding is not currently active, the database was not connected to the server.
facts: Fact2: A mild side effect was discovered.
Fact4: An application was filed for renewal.
Fact5: The research scope was expanded.
Fact6: The microscope did not malfunction in week three.
Fact7: The procedures were not documented in the manual.
Fact8: The spectrometer is not operational for analysis.
Fact9: The paper was not accepted by a conference.
Fact10: The trial was not halted for safety.
Fact11: An extension was not granted by the patent office.
Fact12: Recognition was not awarded to the team.
Fact13: Drug X was not administered during a clinical trial.
Fact14: A research grant did not fund the project.
